class_notes: Site-specific theater is any type of theatrical production designed to be performed at a unique, specially adapted location other than a standard theatre.  The Ensemble in this course will study the history of such work and then create an original piece for a selected performance site to be performed at the end of the semester.
course_description: An ensemble will intensely research, explore, develop, produce, and perform a collaboratively created bare-bones production. The stylistic focus will vary with each offering. The course is a continuation of skills developed in 100 and 200 level courses.
sections: Class Nbr: 3339, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: M 6-8:45p, Instructor: B. Glenn, Status: Open
